New Records: The St. Louis Cardinals achieved their first regular-season win at Yankee Stadium since the 1964 World Series.
Ryan Helsley became the first Cardinal to record a save in the Bronx since Ron Taylor in the 1964 World Series.
Key Match Events: Brendan Donovan hit a three-run homer.
Kyle Gibson pitched seven strong innings.
Iván Herrera hit an RBI double in the sixth and scored on a throwing error.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a three-run double off the top of the center-field fence.
Ryan Helsley worked a shaky ninth for his 42nd save in 45 chances.
Aaron Judge was intentionally walked in the ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Brendan Donovan expressed that winning at Yankee Stadium for the first time in 60 years was special for the organization.
Yankees manager Aaron Boone commented on Giancarlo Stanton's big swing that got the team back in the game.
Kyle Gibson reflected on clearing his mind and focusing on the game after struggling in his previous outings.
Others: Cardinals' LHP Steven Matz is expected to be added to the roster when it expands and may start Monday in Milwaukee.
Yankees' 1B Anthony Rizzo is likely to be activated off the injured list after missing over two months.
